subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New Member and Question

--0-1318933000-1180934152=:24902
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Yeah I get it with most methods too. I questioned them on that and I was given a couple different responses. Think of it as a group effort, many minds coming together to convey the same thought/words. Sometimes you get the opposite effect where they speak over each other with entirely different words. They also said something about alternate realities echo. But thats too big for my tired brain to think about tonight so I will just attach a few echo topic files here and maybe some of you can hear what I hear and see what they have to say. =)
   
  Misty
  PS If you dont see files attached then you dont have individual mail settings turned on for group.

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
          Hi James;

I have gotten that echo wiht almost ever method, EVPmaker, and radio 
scanning methods, or my boxes, there's often a pre-echo, and post echo. I 
don't know what causes it.

Frank

>From: "delchay2005" <azredant@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] New Member and Question
>Date: Sat, 02 Jun 2007 02:03:20 -0000
>
>Hi Everyone,
>
>My name is James from Arizona and have about a million questions about
>EVP. I am a ghosthunter and I have had great success in recording
>EVP's recently. I have included a link to one of our recent
>investigations and recorded an EVP at a restaurant that said "Say
>Goodbye!" as an investigator and myself were walking away from the
>area.This is an authentic EVP.
>
>It came from a cassette tape and has not been altered or filtered in
>the least. I have been an active ghosthunter for about 3 years now.
>Here is the link. Would like to know what you all think of it.
>
>
>http://www.arizonaparanormalinvestigations.com/MSG.htm
>
>
>Question: I am noticing a strange echo reverberation when I record
>loud EVP's. When I record "whisper" type EVP's I don't get this echo.
>
>What do you all think casuses this strange echo quality?
>
>Look forward to talking to all of you!
>
>James
>

__________________________________________________________
